meanings.definition: To remove regulations or controls from (something)
meanings.sent1: The government decided to deregulate the taxi industry, allowing drivers more freedom.
meanings.sent2: It is important to deregulate certain sectors to encourage innovation and competition.
meanings.sent3: The town council's attempt to deregulate parking rules led to chaos on the streets.
meanings.sent4: In the wild west of business, some companies thrive when deregulated, while others struggle.
meanings.sent5: The decision to deregulate the fishing industry had a ripple effect on the local economy.

meanings.definition: To eliminate or reduce government restrictions on (an industry or business)
meanings.sent1: Small businesses often benefit when governments deregulate to promote growth.
meanings.sent2: Economists debate the effects of deregulating the telecommunications sector.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to deregulate the energy market sparked a heated debate among lawmakers.
meanings.sent4: Some argue that deregulating the pharmaceutical industry could lead to lower drug prices.
meanings.sent5: The decision to deregulate the airline industry changed the way people travel.
